metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23998 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Through complicated navigations with new windows, an HTTP page could have inherited a secure lock icon from an HTTPS page. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.10, Thunderbird < 78.10, and Firefox < 88.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23998` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
